content.webTitle: Paul Howlett's TV film picks: Gorky Park | Dreamgirls | The Texas Chain Saw Massacre

fields.headline: Film picks
fields.bodyText: Gorky Park (Michael Apted, 1983) 7.20am & 3.55pm, Sky Movies Action Thriller This melancholic thriller, set in an icy, KGB-ruled Moscow, was adapted by Dennis Potter from Martin Cruz Smith's bestseller. William Hurt is excellent as investigator Renko, called in after the discovery of three frozen, mutilated corpses; Brian Dennehy's rogue New York cop and Lee Marvin's menacing businessman are the wild cards. Dreamgirls (Bill Condon, 2007) 8pm, Sky Movies Premiere Adapted from a 70s Broadway show, Condon's lavish musical follows a Motown group through the heyday of soul and disco. The energised cast includes Beyoncé Knowles as a Diana Ross-type diva, Jennifer Hudson, vying to be leader of their gang, Jamie Foxx a motor-mouthed (it is Detroit) manager and Eddie Murphy as soul man James Early. The Texas Chain Saw Massacre (Tobe Hooper, 1974) 1.45am, Film4 The original adventures of Leatherface, the chainsaw-wielding monster in a mask of human skin (based on the Winsconsin serial killer Ed Gein), and much superior to the various remakes and sequels. The film has a notorious reputation but there's little graphic violence; the shocks mostly stem from the power of suggestion.
